intro: Hybanthus vatsavayae, commonly known as the Vatsavayana flower, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous species characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, with a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
